meanings.definition: The action or process of adapting or being adapted.
meanings.sent1: Her adaption to the new school was smooth and quick.
meanings.sent2: The adaption of the book into a movie was well-received.
meanings.sent3: His adaption to wearing glasses made him look like a different person.
meanings.sent4: The adaption of the play to a musical was a stroke of genius.
meanings.sent5: The adaption of the recipe by adding more spices made it taste delicious.

meanings.definition: A change or adjustment to fit a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: The adaption of the schedule to accommodate more students was necessary.
meanings.sent2: She made a quick adaption to the colder weather by wearing a thicker coat.
meanings.sent3: The adaption of the cat to the new house involved exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: His adaption to the fast-paced city life was like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The adaption of the plant to the sunlight made its leaves vibrant green.
